titleStmt.title: E. P. Davis et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7203

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned citizens of Carter County would respectfully represent to your Excellency Thos E. Bramlett Esqr Governor of The Commonwealth of Ky That at the present Term of this Court, Joseph A Young was found Guilty of Larceny -- Mr Young is a young man without Either Father or Mother his father having been Brutally Murdered, by Guerrillers -- The proof was only circumstantial of his Guilt. Mr Young rendered invaluable Services as a home Guard in the Suppression of the late rebellion. we therefore recommend him as a fit Subject for Executive Clemency and ask that Your Excellency Pardon him

E P Davis clk
J B Ward
B, F, Shepherd
Wm Nethercutt late 2 Lieut ^22 Ky^
H, B, Literal late Capt 40 Ky
J M Summers
James Burtchett Juror
Isaac Burton Juror

Carter Cir Ct
vs
Petition for The pardon of Joseph A Young
Pardoned 12 Oct /65
